identity.mission: Create a tactical, military-grade server management interface that feels like a command center, not a generic admin panel.
principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix military HUD aesthetics with SaaS usability.
Emotion First: Every interaction should feel precise and robust.
Content is King: Data legibility is paramount; status must be instantly readable.
Zoom In: Focus on server health metrics with bold typography.
Negative Space: Use dense grids but keep internal padding for breathability.
Contrast: High contrast for critical alerts (offline/error).

instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the 'Tactical Command' theme by overriding Tailwind config colors.
Use 'Barlow Condensed' for all headings to give that military spec look.
Use 'JetBrains Mono' for all data points (IPs, ports, resource stats).
Create a 'ServerCard' component that uses the 'tactical_corners' visual enhancer.
Ensure the dashboard grid is dense but readable (Bento Grid Mode B).
Use the provided image URLs for the login page and server cards.
Implement real-time status indicators with pulsing animations.
Use Recharts for the resource monitoring pie charts, styled with the theme colors.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur).
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style.
